programme.title: Koyla
programme.desc: A woman who was tricked into marriage falls in love with her evil husband's mute servant, and is locked in a room while her husband tries to get rid of her lover.

programme.title: Last Train to Christmas
programme.desc: Tony Towers, a successful nightclub manager and local celebrity, embarks upon the 3:17 to Nottingham for a Christmas family reunion in 1985, but things soon get a little strange. Moving up a carriage to the buffet car lands him in 1995, where he finds his clubs have failed and his life has fallen apart. Tony discovers that by moving up and down this fateful train, he can transport himself forward and backward to various stages of his life. Not only that, but the actions he takes in one carriage directly affect his life in the next. programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-Nov 2023
programme.desc: A look at the new films available on Sky Cinema in November.

programme.title: The Independent
programme.desc: During the final weeks of the most consequential presidential election campaign in US history, America is poised to elect either its first female president or finally break the country's two-party gridlock with its first viable independent candidate. An idealistic young journalist gets an opportunity to work with her idol, veteran Washington political columnist Nick Booker. Eli is pursuing a story about budget cuts and by following the money, she and Booker uncover a financial conspiracy that places the fate of the election, the country, and democracy in their hands. Director Amy Rice's drama, starring Jodie Turner-Smith, Brian Cox, John Cena and Luke Kirby Amy Rice - Director Jodie Turner-Smith - Elisha \Eli\ James Brian Cox (1) - Nick Booker Luke Kirby - Lucas Nicoll Ann Dowd - Patricia Turnbull John Cena - Nate Sterling Stephen Lang - Gordon White Michael Gandolfini - Justin.

programme.desc: The acclaimed singer is targeted by the Federal Department of Narcotics with an undercover sting operation led by Federal Agent Jimmy Fletcher, with who she had a tumultuous affair. programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biographical drama starring Eddie Redmayne and Alicia Vikander. Copenhagen in the 1920s: Einar and Gerda Wegener are artists who enjoy a happy married and professional life. programme.title: Mrs Harris Goes To Paris
programme.desc: Widowed cleaning lady Ada Harris fixates on a designer dress belonging to one of her clients. A war widow's pension and a windfall secure an airplane ticket to Paris, and Ada innocently gate-crashes the premiere of Dior's 10th anniversary collection. Ada winds up with a unique creation that requires an unexpected stay in the French capital. Comedy drama, starring Lesley Manville, Isabelle Huppert and Lambert Wilson Anthony Fabian - Director.

programme.sub-title: Mystery, Romance, Drama, Crime/detective, Thriller, Comedy ║ 1955 ║ PG
programme.desc: A retired cat burglar becomes the prime suspect for a series of robberies carried out in his own distinctive style, and sets out to clear his name by catching the copycat crook responsible. programme.title: The Pope's Exorcist
programme.desc: Father Gabriele Amorth, chief exorcist of the Vatican, investigates a rundown abbey in San Sebastian. The owner, Julia, claims her 12-year-old son Henry has been possessed by a demon. Local priest Father Esquibel is unprepared to tackle the profanity-spewing malevolence, so Amorth lends his years of experience to the case. programme.title: The Pope's Exorcist
programme.desc: Father Gabriele Amorth, chief exorcist of the Vatican, investigates a rundown abbey in San Sebastian. The owner, Julia, claims her 12-year-old son Henry has been possessed by a demon. Local priest Father Esquibel is unprepared to tackle the profanity-spewing malevolence, so Amorth lends his years of experience to the case. programme.title: Renfield
programme.desc: For more than 100 years, Robert Montague Renfield has been at the beck and call of his manipulative master, Count Dracula.
